userStories.question: What’s your best coping strategy?
userStories.tip: Talking to people and taking time for myself!

userStories.question: Besides medications, what else has worked for you?
userStories.tip: Talking to a professional! Finding the right one is key!

userStories.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
userStories.tip: It's okay! :) Take it one day at a time!

userStories.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?

carousel_items: It'll take 4 to 6 weeks to see the medication's full effects on thoughts and mood.
Can cause dizziness and drowsiness, or worsen you cholesterol and blood sugar levels.
For the first week, avoid activities like driving that require you to be alert.
Don't worry if you see tablet shells in your stool since the medication was already absorbed by your body.
Report any unusual thoughts, inability to control muscle movements, or fever and excess sweating to your doctor.
Elderly people who have dementia shouldn't take Invega.

basics.benefits_moa: Invega is an atypical antipsychotic. Researchers don't know exactly how it works. It seems to change dopamine and serotonin activity in your brain, which affect your thoughts and mood.
basics.bottom_line: Invega is good for treating psychosis and improving mood. It's more likely to cause hormone problems than other antipsychotics.
downsides: Invega has a high risk of causing hormone problems that cause nipples to leak fluid and male breasts to grow abnormally large.
Sometimes causes weight gain and low blood pressure.
Mild risk of causing extrapyramidal symptoms (EPS): movement disorders that include stiffness, tremor, restlessness, and slow, repetitive, or involuntary movements.
You might need routine blood tests to check how the medicine is affecting your body.
Not a good choice for elderly people who have dementia.
All antipsychotics have side effects that make them difficult to take. You might need to try a few different medicines until you find one that works best for you.

downsides_processed.orig: Invega has a high risk of causing hormone problems that cause nipples to leak fluid and male breasts to grow abnormally large.
Sometimes causes weight gain and low blood pressure.
Mild risk of causing extrapyramidal symptoms (EPS): movement disorders that include stiffness, tremor, restlessness, and slow, repetitive, or involuntary movements.
You might need routine blood tests to check how the medicine is affecting your body.
Not a good choice for elderly people who have dementia.
All antipsychotics have side effects that make them difficult to take. You might need to try a few different medicines until you find one that works best for you.

upsides: Effective at relieving psychotic symptoms and relapse rates for people with schizophrenia.
Also relieves psychotic symptoms and improves mood for people with schizoaffective disorder.
Works just as well as other antipsychotic medicines.
Less likely to cause heart or liver problems than some other antipsychotic medications.

upsides_processed.orig: Effective at relieving psychotic symptoms and relapse rates for people with schizophrenia.
Also relieves psychotic symptoms and improves mood for people with schizoaffective disorder.
Works just as well as other antipsychotic medicines.
Less likely to cause heart or liver problems than some other antipsychotic medications.

drugs.one_liner: Helps control your thoughts and mood.
drugs.name: Invega

carousel_items_processed.orig: It'll take 4 to 6 weeks to see the medication's full effects on thoughts and mood.
Can cause dizziness and drowsiness, or worsen you cholesterol and blood sugar levels.
For the first week, avoid activities like driving that require you to be alert.
Don't worry if you see tablet shells in your stool since the medication was already absorbed by your body.
Report any unusual thoughts, inability to control muscle movements, or fever and excess sweating to your doctor.
Elderly people who have dementia shouldn't take Invega.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk of death
risks_warnings.description: Older patients with dementia-related psychosis have a higher risk of death when treated with antipsychotic medications. Invega is not approved to treat dementia-related psychosis.

description_processed.orig: Older patients with dementia-related psychosis have a higher risk of death when treated with antipsychotic medications. Invega is not approved to treat dementia-related psychosis.

risks_warnings.title: Blood disorders
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Invega can lower white blood cell counts. White blood cells help your body fight infections. Tell your doctor if you have any infection symptoms (such as fever, sore throat, or mouth/throat swelling) that don't go away. You may need routine blood tests while on this medication.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Invega can lower white blood cell counts. White blood cells help your body fight infections. Tell your doctor if you have any infection symptoms (such as fever, sore throat, or mouth/throat swelling) that don't go away. You may need routine blood tests while on this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Neuroleptic malignant syndrome
risks_warnings.description: This is a rare but life-threatening condition associated with all antipsychotic (neuroleptic) medications. Symptoms include high fever, fast heart rate, full body stiffness, and confusion. Seek medical attention immediately.

description_processed.orig: This is a rare but life-threatening condition associated with all antipsychotic (neuroleptic) medications. Symptoms include high fever, fast heart rate, full body stiffness, and confusion. Seek medical attention immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Invega can increase your risk of irregular heartbeat. However, Invega causes fewer heart problems compared to some antipsychotic medications. Heart and blood tests may be required before starting treatment.

description_processed.orig: Invega can increase your risk of irregular heartbeat. However, Invega causes fewer heart problems compared to some antipsychotic medications. Heart and blood tests may be required before starting treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Shaking and restlessness
risks_warnings.description: Invega can cause uncontrollable shaking, muscle stiffness, or feeling very restless. However, Invega is less likely to cause these symptoms compared to other antipsychotic medications. Tell your doctor if you experience any abnormal movements or restlessness.

description_processed.orig: Invega can cause uncontrollable shaking, muscle stiffness, or feeling very restless. However, Invega is less likely to cause these symptoms compared to other antipsychotic medications. Tell your doctor if you experience any abnormal movements or restlessness.

risks_warnings.title: Higher blood sugar and cholesterol
risks_warnings.description: Invega can increase your blood sugar and cholesterol. Invega is moderately likely to raise your blood sugar and cholesterol compared to other antipsychotic medications. Exercise and eat healthy food to lower your risk.

description_processed.orig: Invega can increase your blood sugar and cholesterol. Invega is moderately likely to raise your blood sugar and cholesterol compared to other antipsychotic medications. Exercise and eat healthy food to lower your risk.

risks_warnings.title: Weight gain
risks_warnings.description: Invega can cause you to gain weight. Invega is moderately likely to cause weight gain compared to other antipsychotic medications. Exercise and eat healthy food to lower your risk.

description_processed.orig: Invega can cause you to gain weight. Invega is moderately likely to cause weight gain compared to other antipsychotic medications. Exercise and eat healthy food to lower your risk.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Invega impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Invega impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Dizziness and falls may occur due to a sudden drop in blood pressure when you change positions, such as going from sitting to standing. This is called orthostatic hypotension. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change position slowly until your body is used to the medicine. If symptoms persist, a different medication may be better for you.

This is called orthostatic hypotension. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change position slowly until your body is used to the medicine. If symptoms persist, a different medication may be better for you.

carousel_items: It usually takes 4 to 6 weeks to see the full effects, so hang in there and wait until it works to figure out the right dose for you.
Take Geodon twice a day, preferably with food.
Can cause drowsiness when you first start taking it, so avoid activities that require you to be alert until you know how it affects you.
Geodon can cause heart problems, so call your doctor right away if you faint or feel a change in your heartbeat.
Let your doctor know if you're taking a diuretic (water pill) or have a condition like chronic diarrhea that'll lower the amount of potassium or magnesium in your blood.

basics.benefits_moa: Geodon is a second generation antipsychotic. It treats schizophrenia and bipolar disorder by adjusting the levels of dopamine and serotonin in your brain, which affects thoughts and mood.
basics.bottom_line: Geodon treats bipolar disorder and schizophrenia, and causes fewer side effects than similar medicines. It’s not a good choice if you have heart problems.
downsides: Elderly people with dementia shouldn’t take Geodon.

You shouldn’t take Geodon if you have a history of heart problems (slow heart rate, recent heart attack, heart failure, or heart rhythm problems). It’s also not safe to take if you have low potassium or magnesium, or are taking medicines that increase the risk of this happening (diuretics).
You'll need to get blood tests before you start taking Geodon.
It causes slightly less weight gain than similar medicines.
Can't take Geodon capsules and injections at the same time. Capsules should be used instead of the injection as soon as possible.

downsides_processed.orig: Elderly people with dementia shouldn’t take Geodon.

You shouldn’t take Geodon if you have a history of heart problems (slow heart rate, recent heart attack, heart failure, or heart rhythm problems). It’s also not safe to take if you have low potassium or magnesium, or are taking medicines that increase the risk of this happening (diuretics).
You'll need to get blood tests before you start taking Geodon.
It causes slightly less weight gain than similar medicines.
Can't take Geodon capsules and injections at the same time. Capsules should be used instead of the injection as soon as possible.

upsides: Geodon can be used with lithium or valproate to better treat bipolar disorder.
Geodon can treat agitation in people with schizophrenia by reducing symptoms of anxiety, nervousness, and distress.
Compared to other antipsychotics, it has a lower risk of weight gain, hyperglycemia, and hyperlipidemia.
The Geodon capsule is available as a generic.
The injectable form can treat sudden agitation in schizophrenia when it's not possible to use the capsules.
It's available as a pill that you take by mouth daily for continuous treatment and as an injection used for short-term treatment of agitation.

upsides_processed.orig: Geodon can be used with lithium or valproate to better treat bipolar disorder.
Geodon can treat agitation in people with schizophrenia by reducing symptoms of anxiety, nervousness, and distress.
Compared to other antipsychotics, it has a lower risk of weight gain, hyperglycemia, and hyperlipidemia.
The Geodon capsule is available as a generic.
The injectable form can treat sudden agitation in schizophrenia when it's not possible to use the capsules.
It's available as a pill that you take by mouth daily for continuous treatment and as an injection used for short-term treatment of agitation.

drugs.one_liner: Helps control your thoughts and mood.

userStories.tip: I had an extremely bad anxiety attack that lasted hours. Impaired motor skills, hallucinatory thoughts. It was awful. That's on top of extreme insomnia.

userStories.indication: Bipolar I disorder (manic and mixed episodes)
userStories.tip: I think it is too strong for me I seem to just be in the depressive phase of my illness extremely clumsy

There was no weight gain with Geodon, unlike other medicines I have been on, I've actually been able to lose weight on it with diet and exercise.  It does make you sleepy at higher doses but this side affect dwindles once your use to it.

drugs.name: Geodon

labeled_indications.indication: Bipolar I disorder (manic and mixed episodes)

carousel_items_processed.orig: It usually takes 4 to 6 weeks to see the full effects, so hang in there and wait until it works to figure out the right dose for you.
Take Geodon twice a day, preferably with food.
Can cause drowsiness when you first start taking it, so avoid activities that require you to be alert until you know how it affects you.
Geodon can cause heart problems, so call your doctor right away if you faint or feel a change in your heartbeat.
Let your doctor know if you're taking a diuretic (water pill) or have a condition like chronic diarrhea that'll lower the amount of potassium or magnesium in your blood.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk of death
risks_warnings.description: Older patients with dementia-related psychosis have a higher risk of death when treated with antipsychotic medications. Geodon is not approved to treat dementia-related psychosis.

description_processed.orig: Older patients with dementia-related psychosis have a higher risk of death when treated with antipsychotic medications. Geodon is not approved to treat dementia-related psychosis.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Geodon may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Tell your doctor immediately if you have unusual thoughts or feel like your symptoms are getting worse.

description_processed.orig: Geodon may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Tell your doctor immediately if you have unusual thoughts or feel like your symptoms are getting worse.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Geodon can increase your risk of heart rhythm changes and has a higher risk of causing heart problems. It can also interact with other conditions and medicines that affect your heart, by lowering potassium and magnesium. You may need to have heart and blood tests before you start taking Geodon and during treatment.

description_processed.orig: Geodon can increase your risk of heart rhythm changes and has a higher risk of causing heart problems. It can also interact with other conditions and medicines that affect your heart, by lowering potassium and magnesium. You may need to have heart and blood tests before you start taking Geodon and during treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Neuroleptic malignant syndrome (NMS)
risks_warnings.description: This is a rare but life-threatening condition associated with all antipsychotic medications. Symptoms include high fever, fast heart rate, stiff muscles, excess sweating, increased heart rate or blood pressure, and confusion. Get medical attention immediately.

description_processed.orig: This is a rare but life-threatening condition associated with all antipsychotic medications. Symptoms include high fever, fast heart rate, stiff muscles, excess sweating, increased heart rate or blood pressure, and confusion. Get medical attention immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Abnormal and involuntary muscle movements
risks_warnings.description: Although the risk is lower compared to other antipsychotic medications, Geodon can cause muscle stiffness, feelings of restlessness (like you need to move around), and abnormal or uncontrollable facial or body movements, which could be a sign of tardive dyskinesia (TD), a potentially permanent condition. Let your doctor know if you experience any of these symptoms.

description_processed.orig: Although the risk is lower compared to other antipsychotic medications, Geodon can cause muscle stiffness, feelings of restlessness (like you need to move around), and abnormal or uncontrollable facial or body movements, which could be a sign of tardive dyskinesia (TD), a potentially permanent condition. Let your doctor know if you experience any of these symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Dizziness and falls can happen because of a sudden drop in blood pressure when you change positions, such as changing from sitting to standing. This is called orthostatic hypotension. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change position slowly until your body is used to the medicine. If symptoms don't go away, let your doctor know since a different medication may be better for you.

description_processed.orig: Dizziness and falls can happen because of a sudden drop in blood pressure when you change positions, such as changing from sitting to standing. This is called orthostatic hypotension. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change position slowly until your body is used to the medicine. If symptoms don't go away, let your doctor know since a different medication may be better for you.

risks_warnings.title: Risk to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Geodon may cause harm to your unborn baby and should only be used if the benefit is greater than the risk. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications and don't use if you're breast-feeding.

description_processed.orig: Geodon may cause harm to your unborn baby and should only be used if the benefit is greater than the risk. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications and don't use if you're breast-feeding.
